Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.2: NOMINAL ACQUISITION DESIGN ID: the unique id for the acquisition design thatwas nominally intended to be associated with the seismic set. If desired, actualdesigns can be captured at the record level.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.5: PARCEL SIZE: The areal size of a parcel, usually for a set that is three dimensional.linear lengths should be stored in LINE LENGTH.
Column Comment.7: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.8: COORDINATE ACQUISITION ID: Identifies the coordinate acquisition, including themethod used, level of accuracy and quality of the data.
Column Comment.9: CURRENT SEISMIC STATUS: current, most important status for the seismic set.Often, this will be the current ownership status of the seismic set. Denormalized fromSEIS SET STATUS
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.11: END DATE: The date that recording on this seismic set ended.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: FINANCE SUIMMARY IDENTIFIER: Summary information about a financialreference, such as an AFE for an activity, such as seismic acquisition or processing.Could be a cost center or any other reference number.
Column Comment.14: GEOGRAPHIC COORDINATE SYSTEM: a supertype representing all the types ofcoordinate systems allowed in PPDM. This represents the coordinate system usedfor latitude and longitude in SEIS POINT.
Column Comment.15: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.16: MAXIMUM LATITUDE: The NW latitude of the seis set bounding box
Column Comment.17: MAXIMUM LONGITUDE: The NW longitude of the seis set bounding box
Column Comment.18: MINIMUM LATTUDE: The SE latitude of the seis set bounding box
Column Comment.19: MINIMUM LONGITUDE: The SE longitude of the seis set bounding box
Column Comment.20: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.21: PREFERRED NAME: the name by which this seismic set should be referred to.Should be denormalized by script from SEIS ALIAS.
Column Comment.22: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.23: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.24: START DATE: the date that recording on this seismic set began.
Column Comment.25: XY COORDINATE SYSTEM: a supertype representing all the types of coordinatesystems allowed in PPDM. This represents the coordinate system used for X and Ycoordinates (such as UTM) in SEIS POINT.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
